about.summary: Libraries and data formats that support array-oriented scientific data.

name: libnetcdf
raw_recipe:
{% set version = "4.4.1" %}

package:
    name: libnetcdf
    version: {{ version }}

source:
    fn: v{{ version }}.tar.gz
    url: https://github.com/Unidata/netcdf-c/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: 17599385fd76ccdced368f448f654de2ed000fece44dece9fb5d598798b4c9d6
    patches:
        - dfile.c.patch  # [win]
        - dim.c.patch  # [win]

build:
    number: 0
    features:
        - vc9  # [win and py27]
        - vc10  # [win and py34]
        - vc14  # [win and py35]

requirements:
    build:
        - python  # [win]
        - cmake
        - pkg-config  # [unix]
        - msinttypes  # [win]
        - curl
        - zlib 1.2.*
        - hdf4
        - hdf5 1.8.17|1.8.17.*
    run:
        - curl
        - zlib 1.2.*
        - hdf4
        - hdf5 1.8.17|1.8.17.*

test:
    commands:
        - nc-config --all  # [unix]
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libnetcdf.a  # [unix]
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libnetcdf.so  # [linux]
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libnetcdf.dylib  # [osx]
        - conda inspect linkages -n _test libnetcdf  # [linux]
        - conda inspect objects -n _test libnetcdf  # [osx]

about:
    home: http://www.unidata.ucar.edu/software/netcdf/
    license: MIT
    summary: 'Libraries and data formats that support array-oriented scientific data.'

extra:
    recipe-maintainers:
        - groutr
        - ocefpaf
